metadata.description:
This data set includes observation data of meteorological elements in the downstream desert station of Heihe Hydrometeorological Observation Network from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016. The site is located in the desert beach of Ejina Banner, Inner Mongolia, and the underlying surface is desert. The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 100.9872E, 42.1135N, and the altitude is 1054m. The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are installed at 5m and 10m, facing the north; the barometer is installed at 2m; the tipping bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m; the wind speed sensor is set at 5m, 10m, and the wind direction sensor is set at 10m, facing the north; the four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing south; two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing south, the probe orientation is vertically downward; the soil temperature probe is buried in the ground surface 0cm and underground 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm 40cm, 60cm and 100cm, in the south of the 2m from the meteorological tower; soil moisture sensors are buried in the underground 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm, in the south of the 2m from the meteorological tower; soil heat flux plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6 cm in order.
Observation items include: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m, Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: centigrade, percentage), air pressure (Press) (unit: hectopascal), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m / s), wind direction (WD_10m) (unit: degree), four-component radiation (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts / square meter), surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2 ) (unit: centigrade), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts/square meter), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_60cm, Ms_100cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage) and soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm) (unit: centigrade).
Processing and quality control of the observation data: (1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10 minutes), when there is missing data, it is marked by -6999; (2) eliminate the moment with duplicate records; (3) delete the data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument; (5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column. For example, the time is: 2016-6-10 10:30; (6) the naming rules are: AWS+ site name.
For hydrometeorological network or site information, please refer to Li et al. (2013). For observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).

该数据集包含了2016年1月1日至2016年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网下游荒漠站气象要素观测数据，站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗荒漠滩，下垫面是荒漠。观测点的经纬度是100.9872E, 42.1135N，海拔1054m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m，风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2016-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在实际的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）与使用波 Bowen 比率–能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果的比较。

在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差，这一温差是主导因素。结果显示，与观察到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强平流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量使用位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值很好地一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度协方差（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖了FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，该地区自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被先前研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，涵盖了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of hierarchical instrumentation in multiscale observation experiments?
Definition.QuestionCn: 层次化仪器在多尺度观测实验中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Hierarchical instrumentation in multiscale observation experiments is significant because it allows researchers to capture eco-hydrological processes across different scales. This approach addresses the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations by organizing instruments in nested scales, enabling detailed investigation of interactions in systems like oasis-desert landscapes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 分层仪器在多尺度观测实验中具有重要意义，因为它允许研究人员在不同尺度上捕捉生态水文过程。这种方法通过将仪器组织在嵌套尺度中，解决了多尺度观测可用性差的挑战，从而能够详细研究像绿洲-沙漠景观这样的系统中的相互作用。

Definition.QuestionEn: How does the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model differ from one-source evapotranspiration estimation models in terms of handling heterogeneous surfaces?
Definition.QuestionCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型与单源蒸散估算模型在处理异质表面方面有何不同？
Definition.AnswerEn: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model differs from one-source evapotranspiration estimation models by separately considering soil and vegetation components rather than combining them into a single source. This separation allows for more accurate estimation of surface evapotranspiration on heterogeneous surfaces, which contain mixtures of soil and vegetation with different temperatures and resistances to energy exchange.
Definition.AnswerCn: 两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型与单源蒸散发估算模型的不同之处在于，它分别考虑土壤和植被成分，而不是将它们合并为一个单一的源。这种分离使得在具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合的异质表面上，能够更准确地估算表面蒸散发。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do data collection methods for soil and canopy component temperatures using a high-resolution thermal camera compare to those using ground-based meteorological sensors in terms of accuracy and application in arid regions?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪收集土壤和冠层组件温度的数据收集方法与使用地面气象传感器的方法在准确性和在干旱地区的应用方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Data collection using a high-resolution thermal camera involves capturing thermal images and converting them into radiometric temperatures, while ground-based meteorological sensors measure direct parameters like air temperature, wind speed, and humidity. The thermal camera method allows for the separation of soil and canopy temperatures, which is crucial for models like TSEB, whereas ground-based sensors provide detailed meteorological data but may face challenges in effectively separating soil and canopy temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪进行数据收集涉及捕获热图像并将其转换为辐射温度，而地面气象传感器则测量空气温度、风速和湿度等直接参数。热像仪方法允许分离土壤和冠层温度，这对于像TSEB这样的模型至关重要，而地面传感器提供详细的气象数据，但在异质景观中可能面临有效分离土壤和冠层温度的挑战。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the use of different sensor heights and orientations influence data accuracy in meteorological observations collected in desert environments?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 不同传感器高度和方向的使用如何影响在沙漠环境中收集的气象观测数据的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The meteorological observations collected in desert environments involve different sensor heights and orientations, such as air temperature and relative humidity sensors at 5m and 10m, and wind speed sensors also at these heights. The positioning of sensors can influence the accuracy of measurements by affecting exposure to environmental variables like wind and temperature. For instance, different heights might capture variations in microclimates, while orientation towards true north or south might minimize interference from the sun's path or prevailing winds, ensuring more consistent data collection.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在沙漠环境中收集的气象观测涉及不同的传感器高度和方向，例如在5米和10米高度的空气温度和相对湿度传感器，以及在这些高度的风速传感器。传感器的定位可能会影响测量的准确性，因为它会影响对环境变量（如风和温度）的暴露。例如，不同的高度可能捕捉到微气候的变化，而朝向真北或真南的方向可能会减少来自太阳路径或主导风的干扰，从而确保更一致的数据收集。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges arise in separating soil and canopy component temperatures when estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在估算异质景观中的蒸散发时，分离土壤和冠层组分温度会面临哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: In heterogeneous landscapes, one challenge in separating soil and canopy component temperatures for evapotranspiration estimation arises from the difficulty in accurately classifying image pixels into soil and vegetation due to varying vegetation abundance. Errors in classification lead to inaccurate temperature readings, with soil pixels being mistakenly classified as vegetation, resulting in overestimation of canopy temperature. Additionally, atmospheric factors like upwelling radiation and transmittance further complicate the accurate estimation of temperatures, which are crucial for reliable evapotranspiration calculations.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中，分离土壤和冠层组分温度以估算蒸散发的一个挑战是，由于植被丰度的变化，准确分类图像像素为土壤和植被的困难。分类错误导致温度读数不准确，土壤像素被错误地分类为植被，从而导致冠层温度的高估。此外，上行辐射和透射等大气因素进一步复杂化了温度的准确估计，而这些温度对于可靠的蒸散发计算至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do variations in instrumentation and scale affect the collection and interpretation of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 乐器和规模的变化如何影响绿洲-沙漠系统中生态水文过程的收集和解释？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: In oasis-desert systems, variations in instrumentation and scale significantly affect the collection and interpretation of eco-hydrological processes. The use of hierarchically nested scales with instruments like eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations allows researchers to capture multi-scale processes. However, challenges arise in ensuring data consistency and integration across these scales. For example, instruments placed at different scales might measure varying microclimates or hydrological conditions, requiring careful calibration and data processing to accurately interpret the interactions between oasis and desert systems.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，仪器和尺度的变化显著影响生态水文过程的收集和解释。使用分层嵌套尺度的仪器，如涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站，使研究人员能够捕捉多尺度过程。然而，在确保这些尺度之间的数据一致性和整合方面会出现挑战。例如，放置在不同尺度的仪器可能测量到不同的微气候或水文条件，这需要仔细的校准和数据处理，以准确解释绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the primary reasons behind the challenges in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在异质表面上收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测面临的主要挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces primarily arise from the poor availability of such observations. Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why do errors occur in estimating evapotranspiration in arid regions using models like the TSEB model?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区使用像TSEB模型这样的模型估计蒸散发时，为什么会出现误差？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in estimating evapotranspiration using models like the TSEB model in arid regions occur due to several factors, including the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences, image classification errors, and the strong advective environment. These errors are often exacerbated by the difficulty in accurately determining soil and vegetation component temperatures from surface composite radiometric temperatures.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，使用像TSEB模型这样的模型估算蒸散发时，错误的产生源于多个因素，包括地表与空气温度差异的不确定性、影像分类错误以及强烈的平流环境。这些错误往往因难以准确确定土壤和植被组分温度与表面复合辐射温度之间的关系而加剧。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the difficulty in maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间平衡的困难原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The difficulty in maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems in arid regions is caused by ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, increased land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These issues are especially prevalent in inland river basins along the Silk Road, impacting the ecological stability and sustainable development of oases.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间平衡的困难，主要是由于生态环境退化所致，例如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些问题在丝绸之路沿线的内陆河流流域尤为突出，影响了绿洲的生态稳定性和可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to separate soil and canopy component temperatures when estimating evapotranspiration using models like TSEB?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在使用像TSEB这样的模型估算蒸散时，为什么分离土壤和冠层成分温度是至关重要的？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Separating soil and canopy component temperatures is essential because it enables more accurate estimations of evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET). The TSEB model, for instance, uses these temperatures to improve the estimation of energy balance components, leading to reliable estimates of E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and ET, especially under conditions where traditional methods face challenges due to strong advective environments.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 分离土壤和冠层组件温度是至关重要的，因为它能够更准确地估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET）。例如，TSEB模型利用这些温度来改善能量平衡组件的估算，从而在传统方法因强烈的平流环境而面临挑战的情况下，提供可靠的E/ET%和T/ET%比率及ET的估算。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What goals drive the creation of long-term datasets for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis-desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 驱动沙漠绿洲系统中能源、水汽和碳交换观测长期数据集创建的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goals behind creating long-term datasets for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis-desert systems include understanding the basic characteristics of these exchanges to achieve carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals, supporting ecological security, and enabling sustainable development of oasis regions. Such datasets help in recognizing oasis-desert interactions and protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 创建能源、水汽和碳交换观测的长期数据集的目标包括理解这些交换的基本特征，以实现碳达峰和碳中和目标，支持生态安全，并促进绿洲地区的可持续发展。这些数据集有助于识别绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用，保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What specific steps and instrumentation are involved in setting up a meteorological observation network to collect hydrometeorological data in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区建立气象观测网络以收集水文气象数据涉及哪些具体步骤和仪器？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To set up a meteorological observation network in arid regions, instrumentation should include automatic weather stations with sensors for air temperature, humidity, wind speed, radiation, and soil heat flux. These stations should be strategically placed across different landscapes, such as deserts and oases, to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. Additionally, eddy covariance systems and scintillometers are required for measuring turbulent fluxes, and a network of soil moisture sensors should be established. Data collection involves continuous monitoring with regular data quality control, including sensor calibration and validation against ground measurements.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区建立气象观测网络时，仪器设备应包括自动气象站，配备空气温度、湿度、风速、辐射和土壤热通量传感器。这些站点应在不同的地形上战略性布置，如沙漠和绿洲，以捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程。此外，还需要涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪来测量湍流通量，并建立土壤湿度传感器网络。数据收集涉及持续监测，并定期进行数据质量控制，包括传感器校准和与地面测量的验证。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural challenges are commonly faced in maintaining data quality and consistency in long-term hydrometeorological datasets collected from oasis-desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在维护从绿洲-沙漠系统收集的长期水文气象数据集的数据质量和一致性时，通常会面临哪些程序性挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Maintaining data quality and consistency in long-term datasets involves several challenges, including sensor calibration drift, data gaps due to equipment failure, and environmental impacts such as dust storms. Quality control procedures must include regular sensor maintenance and calibration, as well as data validation checks to identify and correct anomalies. Data gaps might be flagged with placeholders, such as -6999, and redundant data points should be identified and removed. Additionally, classification errors in remote sensing data can lead to uncertainties, which require rigorous validation and correction protocols.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 维护长期数据集的数据质量和一致性面临多个挑战，包括传感器校准漂移、设备故障导致的数据缺口，以及尘暴等环境影响。质量控制程序必须包括定期的传感器维护和校准，以及数据验证检查，以识别和纠正异常情况。数据缺口可以用占位符标记，例如 -6999，冗余数据点应被识别并删除。此外，遥感数据中的分类错误可能导致不确定性，这需要严格的验证和纠正协议。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What instrumentation and hierarchical observation setups enable the monitoring of multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 什么样的仪器和分层观察设置能够监测异质绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度生态水文过程？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Instruments for the oasis-desert system are arranged in hierarchically nested scales, including a sparse network to investigate oasis-desert interaction and a superstation within the oasis. This setup includes eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and sensors for soil moisture and leaf area index, among others.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按层次嵌套的尺度进行安排，包括一个稀疏网络以研究绿洲与沙漠的相互作用，以及一个位于绿洲内的超级站。该设置包括涡度协方差塔、自动气象站、土壤湿度传感器和叶面积指数传感器等。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is there a challenge in obtaining multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在异质表面上获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测存在挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. This is because capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes requires a hierarchically nested instrumentation approach, which involves extensive and varied data collection methods.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。这是因为捕捉多尺度生态水文过程需要一种分层嵌套的仪器方法，这涉及到广泛而多样的数据收集方法。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures be crucial for accurately estimating evapotranspiration using models?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 土壤和植被组件温度的分离对于准确估计使用模型的蒸散发至关重要，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The TSEB model's performance is primarily affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference, which can lead to inaccuracies when the surface composite radiometric temperature does not accurately represent soil and vegetation components. Accurately separating and estimating these component temperatures is crucial for reliable evapotranspiration estimates.
Expectation.AnswerCn: TSEB模型的性能主要受到地表与空气温度差异的不确定性影响，当地表复合辐射温度无法准确代表土壤和植被成分时，可能导致不准确的结果。准确分离和估计这些成分的温度对于可靠的蒸散发估算至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is long-term observation indispensable for understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换是不可或缺的？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are critical to achieving a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas. This understanding is significant for recognizing oasis–desert interactions, ensuring ecological stability, and supporting the socioeconomic development of oases.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于实现对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解至关重要。这种理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用、确保生态稳定以及支持绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of the data collection methods used in capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您对在绿洲-沙漠环境中捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的数据收集方法的有效性有何评估？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods in oasis-desert environments, particularly those involving hierarchically nested scales and the use of diverse instruments like eddy covariance towers and automatic meteorological stations, effectively capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes. These methods are complemented by remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR and thermal imaging, providing comprehensive datasets. However, the complexity of integrating multiscale observations remains a challenge, suggesting room for further refinement and innovation in these techniques.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠环境中的数据收集方法，特别是涉及分层嵌套尺度和使用多种仪器如涡度协方差塔和自动气象站，有效捕捉了多尺度生态水文过程。这些方法得到了遥感技术的补充，如激光雷达和热成像，提供了全面的数据集。然而，整合多尺度观测的复杂性仍然是一个挑战，这表明在这些技术上还有进一步改进和创新的空间。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your perspective on the potential for expanding datasets to include long-term observations of energy and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert systems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您对扩大数据集以包括绿洲-沙漠系统中能量和碳通量的长期观测的潜力有何看法？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Expanding datasets to include long-term observations of energy and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert systems is crucial for understanding ecological stability and supporting sustainable development. The establishment of multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations since 2012 provides a foundation for such expansion. Continuous data collection, quality control, and the integration of various parameters, including vegetation and soil data, are essential for comprehensive and reliable datasets that can inform ecological and economic strategies in these regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 扩展数据集以包括绿洲-沙漠系统的长期能量和碳通量观测，对于理解生态稳定性和支持可持续发展至关重要。自2012年以来建立的多个地表通量和气象站为这种扩展提供了基础。持续的数据收集、质量控制以及对包括植被和土壤数据在内的各种参数的整合，对于形成全面可靠的数据集至关重要，这些数据集可以为这些地区的生态和经济战略提供信息。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced in collecting and processing multiscale eco-hydrological data in arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在干旱地区收集和处理多尺度生态水文数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data in arid regions is challenging due to the heterogeneity of the landscape and the poor availability of multiscale observations. The presence of mixed soil and vegetation, as well as extreme weather conditions, complicate data collection and processing. Additionally, errors in image classification and uncertainties in temperature and radiation estimation can affect data quality.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区收集多尺度生态水文数据具有挑战性，因为景观的异质性和多尺度观测的稀缺性。混合土壤和植被的存在，以及极端天气条件，进一步 complicate 数据收集和处理。此外，图像分类中的错误以及温度和辐射估计的不确定性可能会影响数据质量。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the challenges encountered in obtaining multiscale observations in oasis-desert systems and propose strategies to overcome these limitations.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在绿洲-沙漠系统中获取多尺度观测所遇到的挑战，并提出克服这些限制的策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in obtaining multiscale observations include limited availability of data across different scales and the complex interactions in heterogeneous landscapes. Strategies to overcome these limitations could involve using a combination of ground-based sensors, remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and thermal imagers, and developing a hierarchical network of observation systems to ensure data collection at multiple scales. Implementing continuous observation periods and leveraging advanced data fusion techniques may also help address these challenges.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 获取多尺度观测的挑战包括在不同尺度上数据的有限可用性以及异质景观中复杂的相互作用。克服这些限制的策略可以包括使用地面传感器、遥感技术如激光雷达和热成像仪的组合，以及建立分层的观测系统网络，以确保在多个尺度上进行数据收集。实施连续观测期并利用先进的数据融合技术也可能有助于解决这些挑战。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please investigate the potential for expanding hydrometeorological datasets in arid and semiarid regions and propose methods for integrating additional environmental parameters.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请调查在干旱和半干旱地区扩展水文气象数据集的潜力，并提出整合其他环境参数的方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Expansion of hydrometeorological datasets could involve incorporating additional environmental parameters like carbon and methane fluxes, soil moisture profiles, and vegetation dynamics. Methods to achieve this might include using advanced remote sensing tools, integrating data from different observational platforms, and enhancing sensor networks with new technologies. Collaborations with international research initiatives and making datasets freely available can also facilitate the expansion and integration of valuable environmental data.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 水文气象数据集的扩展可以涉及纳入额外的环境参数，如碳和甲烷通量、土壤湿度剖面和植被动态。实现这一目标的方法可能包括使用先进的遥感工具、整合来自不同观测平台的数据，以及利用新技术增强传感器网络。与国际研究计划的合作以及将数据集免费提供也可以促进有价值环境数据的扩展和整合。
